title: Recipe New Session Toggle
description:
## Design Document
@docs/design/recipe-new-session-toggle.md

## Overview
Add a toggle to RecipeMenuView that allows users to start recipes in a fresh session instead of the current session. When enabled, generates a new UUID and sends it to the backend, which creates the session automatically. User receives confirmation alert and can navigate to the new session from the Sessions list.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Toggle labeled "Start in new session" appears in RecipeMenuView above the recipe list
2. Toggle defaults to OFF (disabled) each time the sheet opens
3. When toggle is ON and recipe selected:
   - New lowercase UUID is generated
   - `start_recipe` WebSocket message contains the new UUID as `session_id`
   - Confirmation alert appears with title "Recipe Started"
   - Alert message indicates recipe is in a new session
   - User must tap OK to dismiss the sheet
4. When toggle is OFF and recipe selected:
   - Current session ID is used in `start_recipe` message
   - Sheet dismisses automatically after `recipe_started` confirmation (existing behavior)
5. New session appears in Sessions list within a few seconds via existing replication
6. New session has the same working directory as the session where the recipe was initiated
7. Toggle state does not persist between sheet presentations

title: Add toggle UI section to recipe list
Modify selectRecipe to generate new session ID when toggle enabled
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/recipe-new-session-toggle.md#code-examples

## Context
Core logic change that determines which session ID to use when starting a recipe. When the toggle is ON, generates a new lowercase UUID instead of using the current session ID.

## Requirements
- [ ] Check `useNewSession` state at start of `selectRecipe()`
- [ ] If true, generate new UUID: `UUID().uuidString.lowercased()`
- [ ] If false, use existing `sessionId` parameter
- [ ] Log which session ID is being used
- [ ] Capture `useNewSession` value before async operation for use in completion handler

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `ios/VoiceCode/Views/RecipeMenuView.swift`
- New files to create: None
- Dependencies: Task "Add state properties for new session toggle"

Modify the start of `selectRecipe()`:
```swift
private func selectRecipe(recipeId: String) {
    // NEW: Determine which session ID to use
    let targetSessionId: String
    if useNewSession {
        targetSessionId = UUID().uuidString.lowercased()
        print("ðŸ“¤ [RecipeMenuView] Starting recipe in NEW session: \(targetSessionId)")
    } else {
        targetSessionId = sessionId
    }
    
    // ... rest uses targetSessionId instead of sessionId ...
    client.startRecipe(sessionId: targetSessionId, recipeId: recipeId, workingDirectory: workingDirectory)
    
    // Capture for use in closure
    let shouldShowConfirmation = useNewSession
    
    // Update Combine subscription to use targetSessionId
    client.$activeRecipes
        .first { $0[targetSessionId] != nil }
        // ...
}
```

## Verification
- [ ] Build succeeds
- [ ] Console log shows "NEW session" message when toggle is ON
- [ ] Console log shows existing session ID when toggle is OFF
- [ ] WebSocket message contains correct session_id

## Acceptance Criteria
- When toggle is ON: New lowercase UUID is generated (AC #3a)
- When toggle is ON: `start_recipe` WebSocket message contains the new UUID as `session_id` (AC #3b)
- When toggle is OFF: Current session ID is used in `start_recipe` message (AC #4a)

## Parallelization
Can be worked alongside: "Add toggle UI section to recipe list" (both depend on state properties)

title: Add confirmation alert for new session recipe start
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/recipe-new-session-toggle.md#code-examples

## Context
When a recipe starts in a new session, users need feedback since they won't automatically navigate to the new session. This task adds a confirmation alert that informs the user and provides clear next steps.

## Requirements
- [ ] Add `.alert()` modifier to NavigationView
- [ ] Alert title: "Recipe Started"
- [ ] Alert message: "Recipe is running in a new session. Go to Sessions to view it."
- [ ] Single "OK" button that dismisses both alert and sheet
- [ ] Modify Combine completion handler to show alert when `shouldShowConfirmation` is true
- [ ] Use binding wrapper pattern consistent with existing codebase

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: `ios/VoiceCode/Views/RecipeMenuView.swift`
- New files to create: None
- Dependencies: 
  - Task "Add state properties for new session toggle"
  - Task "Modify selectRecipe to generate new session ID when toggle enabled"

Add alert modifier after NavigationView:
```swift
.alert("Recipe Started", isPresented: $showingNewSessionConfirmation) {
    Button("OK") {
        dismiss()
    }
} message: {
    Text("Recipe is running in a new session. Go to Sessions to view it.")
}
```

Modify the Combine `receiveValue` handler:
```swift
receiveValue: { [self] _ in
    isLoadingBinding.wrappedValue = false
    if shouldShowConfirmation {
        self.showingNewSessionConfirmation = true
    } else {
        dismissAction()
    }
}
```

## Verification
- [ ] Build succeeds
- [ ] Alert appears when starting recipe with toggle ON
- [ ] Alert does NOT appear when starting recipe with toggle OFF
- [ ] Tapping OK dismisses alert and sheet
- [ ] Sheet dismisses automatically when toggle is OFF (existing behavior preserved)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Confirmation alert appears with title "Recipe Started" (AC #3c)
- Alert message indicates recipe is in a new session (AC #3d)
- User must tap OK to dismiss the sheet (AC #3e)
- When toggle is OFF: Sheet dismisses automatically after `recipe_started` confirmation (AC #4b)

title: Manual testing of recipe new session toggle
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/recipe-new-session-toggle.md#integration-tests-manual-test-script

## Context
Final verification step to ensure the feature works end-to-end. Executes the 4 manual test scenarios defined in the design document to validate all acceptance criteria.

## Requirements
- [ ] Execute Test 1: New Session Recipe Start
- [ ] Execute Test 2: Existing Session Recipe Start (Toggle Off)
- [ ] Execute Test 3: Working Directory Inheritance
- [ ] Execute Test 4: Toggle State Reset

## Technical Approach
- Files to modify: None
- New files to create: None
- Dependencies: All previous implementation tasks

### Prerequisites
- iOS app connected to backend
- At least one recipe available (e.g., "implement-and-review")
- Existing session with a working directory set

### Test 1: New Session Recipe Start
1. Open an existing session in ConversationView
2. Tap the recipe button in the toolbar
3. Verify the "Start in new session" toggle appears at the top of the list
4. Verify the toggle is OFF by default
5. Enable the toggle (switch to ON)
6. Select any recipe (e.g., "Implement & Review")
7. Wait for recipe to start (loading indicator)
8. Verify an alert appears with title "Recipe Started"
9. Verify alert message says "Recipe is running in a new session. Go to Sessions to view it."
10. Tap "OK" to dismiss
11. Navigate back to Sessions list
12. Verify a new session appears with the same working directory
13. Open the new session and verify the recipe is active (green recipe icon)

### Test 2: Existing Session Recipe Start (Toggle Off)
1. Open an existing session in ConversationView
2. Tap the recipe button in the toolbar
3. Verify the toggle is OFF (default state)
4. Do NOT enable the toggle
5. Select any recipe
6. Verify the sheet dismisses automatically (no confirmation alert)
7. Verify the recipe is running in the CURRENT session (not a new one)
8. Verify no new session was created in Sessions list

### Test 3: Working Directory Inheritance
1. Create or open a session with working directory `/path/to/project`
2. Start a recipe with "Start in new session" enabled
3. After recipe starts, navigate to the new session
4. Verify the new session's working directory is `/path/to/project` (same as parent)

### Test 4: Toggle State Reset
1. Open recipe menu, enable the toggle
2. Cancel (dismiss without selecting)
3. Re-open recipe menu
4. Verify the toggle is OFF (state should not persist)

## Verification
- [ ] All 4 test scenarios pass
- [ ] No regressions in existing recipe functionality

## Acceptance Criteria
Validates ALL acceptance criteria (AC #1-7)

title: Delta Sync Session History
description:
## Design Document
@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md

## Overview
Implement delta sync for session history to eliminate redundant message transfer and improve truncation behavior. When iOS subscribes to a session, it sends the UUID of its newest cached message. The backend only sends messages newer than that ID, using smart per-message truncation (20KB max) instead of dividing budget equally among all messages.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Subscribe with `last_message_id` returns only newer messages
2. Subscribe without `last_message_id` returns recent messages (backward compatible)
3. Messages under 20KB are never truncated
4. Messages over 20KB are truncated with marker showing size
5. Response never exceeds client's max message size setting
6. Newest messages are prioritized when budget is exhausted
7. `is_complete: false` indicates budget exhaustion
8. iOS displays truncated content with appropriate indicator
9. All existing tests continue to pass

title: Implement build-session-history-response function
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md#backend-new-truncation-algorithm

## Context
This is the core algorithm for delta sync. It replaces the current equal-budget truncation with smart per-message truncation that prioritizes recent messages and preserves small messages intact.

## Requirements
- [ ] Create `per-message-max-bytes` constant (20KB)
- [ ] Implement `build-session-history-response` function with delta sync logic
- [ ] Find messages newer than `last-message-id` (or all if not provided)
- [ ] Work backwards from newest message, adding until budget exhausted
- [ ] Truncate only messages exceeding per-message-max (20KB)
- [ ] Return `is-complete`, `oldest-message-id`, `newest-message-id`

## Technical Approach
- File to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj`
- Algorithm:
  1. Find index of last-message-id in message list
  2. Get messages newer than that index (or all if not found)
  3. Reverse to process newest first
  4. Loop: truncate large messages, add to result until budget exhausted
  5. Reverse back to chronological order
  6. Return with metadata fields

## Verification
- [ ] Unit test: Empty message list returns empty result with nil IDs
- [ ] Unit test: All messages fit in budget â†’ is-complete true
- [ ] Unit test: Budget exhausted mid-way â†’ is-complete false, newest prioritized
- [ ] Unit test: last-message-id found â†’ only newer messages returned
- [ ] Unit test: last-message-id not found â†’ all recent messages returned
- [ ] Unit test: Large messages (>20KB) truncated with marker
- [ ] Unit test: Small messages (<20KB) preserved intact

## Acceptance Criteria
- Messages under 20KB are never truncated
- Messages over 20KB are truncated with marker showing size
- Newest messages are prioritized when budget is exhausted

title: Update subscribe handler to use delta sync algorithm
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md#backend-updated-subscribe-handler

## Context
The subscribe handler must be updated to parse the new `last_message_id` field, call the new `build-session-history-response` function, and return the new response fields.

- File to modify: `backend/src/voice_code/server.clj`
- In the "subscribe" case of message handler:
  1. Extract `last-message-id` from data map
  2. Call `build-session-history-response` with filtered messages, last-message-id, and max-bytes
  3. Destructure result to get messages, is-complete, oldest-message-id, newest-message-id
  4. Include all fields in `session-history` response

## Dependencies

## Verification

- [ ] Integration test: Subscribe with valid last_message_id returns only newer
- [ ] Integration test: Subscribe with stale/unknown last_message_id returns recent messages
- [ ] Integration test: Response includes is_complete, oldest_message_id, newest_message_id
- [ ] All existing subscribe tests continue to pass

## Acceptance Criteria
- Subscribe with `last_message_id` returns only newer messages
- Subscribe without `last_message_id` returns recent messages (backward compatible)
- All existing tests continue to pass

title: Implement iOS getNewestCachedMessageId function
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md#ios-updated-subscribe-call

## Context
iOS needs a function to query CoreData for the newest message UUID for a given session. This UUID will be sent to the backend as `last_message_id` to enable delta sync.

## Requirements
- [ ] Create `getNewestCachedMessageId(sessionId:)` function in VoiceCodeClient
- [ ] Query CDMessage sorted by timestamp descending, limit 1
- [ ] Return the message's UUID as lowercase string (per STANDARDS.md)
- [ ] Return nil on error or if no messages exist
- [ ] Log errors for debugging

## Technical Approach
- File to modify: `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/VoiceCodeClient.swift`
- Implementation:
  1. Parse sessionId string to UUID
  2. Create NSFetchRequest for CDMessage
  3. Set predicate: sessionId == uuid
  4. Set sort: timestamp descending
  5. Set fetchLimit: 1
  6. Execute fetch on PersistenceController.shared.container.viewContext
  7. Return first result's id.uuidString.lowercased()

## Parallelization
Can be worked alongside: "Update subscribe handler to use delta sync algorithm"

## Verification
- [ ] Manual test: Function returns correct UUID for session with messages
- [ ] Manual test: Function returns nil for session with no messages
- [ ] Manual test: Function returns nil for invalid session ID
- [ ] Verify UUID is lowercase

## Acceptance Criteria
- iOS can retrieve the newest cached message ID for any session

title: Update iOS subscribe to send last_message_id
description:

@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md#ios-updated-subscribe-call

## Context
The iOS subscribe call must be updated to include `last_message_id` when subscribing to a session. This enables delta sync, reducing redundant data transfer.

## Requirements

- [ ] Log whether delta sync is being used

- In `subscribe(sessionId:)`:
  1. Call getNewestCachedMessageId(sessionId:)

  3. If lastMessageId exists, add "last_message_id" key
  4. Log delta sync status
  5. Send message

- [ ] Manual test: Subscribe message omits last_message_id when no cached messages

title: Handle is_complete response in iOS session history
description:
## Design Reference
@docs/design/delta-sync-session-history.md#ios-handle-incomplete-response

## Context
iOS needs to handle the new `is_complete` field in session_history responses. When false, it indicates the budget was exhausted before all messages could be sent, meaning there's a gap in history.

## Requirements
- [ ] Parse `is_complete` field from session_history response
- [ ] Parse `oldest_message_id` and `newest_message_id` fields
- [ ] Log warning when is_complete is false
- [ ] Optionally display indicator to user when history is incomplete

## Technical Approach
- File to modify: `ios/VoiceCode/Managers/VoiceCodeClient.swift`
- In session_history case handler:
  1. Extract is_complete boolean (default true for backward compatibility)
  2. Extract oldest_message_id and newest_message_id strings
  3. Log if is_complete is false
  4. Consider: notify delegate or post notification for UI indicator

## Parallelization
Can be worked alongside: "Update iOS subscribe to send last_message_id"

## Dependencies
- Requires: "Update subscribe handler to use delta sync algorithm" (backend must send the fields)

## Verification
- [ ] Manual test: is_complete=true logged correctly
- [ ] Manual test: is_complete=false triggers warning log
- [ ] Manual test: Missing is_complete field defaults to true (backward compat)
- [ ] Console shows oldest/newest message IDs

## Acceptance Criteria
- `is_complete: false` indicates budget exhaustion
- iOS displays truncated content with appropriate indicator
